column1: Rent control. Vermont state laws neither prohibits nor enforces rent control. As such, Vermont landlords may charge what they wish in rental prices. The state also does now allow local jurisdictions to enact rent control policies without state approval.
Rental increases. Vermont landlords are not limited in how much they can raise rental prices. However, they must provide at least 60 daysâ€™ notice before raising the rent.
Rent-related fees. The state does not currently limit the value of late fees. However, the state does prohibit charging application fees.
